dcterms:creator: D. Gale
L. S. Shapley
dcterms:description: This dataset is based on the deferred acceptance algorithm, which is a method for solving the stable marriage problem, ensuring that no pair of individuals would prefer to be matched with each other over their current partners.
dcterms:title: Gale and Shapley’s deferred acceptance algorithm

dcterms:creator: H. Adachi
dcterms:description: Adachi's formulation provides a characterization of stable matchings, offering a necessary and sufficient condition for stability in matching problems.
dcterms:title: Adachi’s formulation

dcterms:creator: A. Galichon
L. Samuelson
L. Vernet
dcterms:description: This dataset discusses monotone comparative statics for equilibrium problems, providing insights into how changes in parameters affect equilibrium outcomes.
dcterms:title: Monotone comparative statics for equilibrium problems

dcterms:creator: A. Galichon
S. D. Kominers
S. Weber
dcterms:description: This dataset presents an empirical framework for matching with imperfectly transferable utility, focusing on the concept of costly concessions in matching scenarios.
dcterms:title: Costly concessions

dcterms:creator: A. Galichon
Y.-W. Hsieh
M. Sylvestre
dcterms:description: This dataset explores monotone comparative statics for submodular functions, with applications to aggregated deferred acceptance, providing insights into the behavior of such functions in economic models.
dcterms:title: Monotone comparative statics for submodular functions

dcterms:creator: J. Ortega
W. Rheinboldt
dcterms:description: This dataset focuses on iterative methods for solving nonlinear equations in several variables, providing foundational techniques for numerical analysis.
dcterms:title: Iterative Solution of Nonlinear Equations in Several Variables

dcterms:creator: D. E. Knuth
dcterms:description: This dataset provides an introduction to the mathematical analysis of algorithms, specifically focusing on the stable marriage problem and its combinatorial implications.
dcterms:title: Stable marriage and its relation to other combinatorial problems
